pulltitle: Fixes footer issues with long strings.
pullsbody:
Locales like de use long strings in the footer and cause a
variety of issues. This commit makes the footer more flexible
with regards to long strings.
pull_repo_desc: Common header/footer templates and CSS for Django-based Mozilla sites.

Fixes footer issues with long strings.

Locales like de use long strings in the footer and cause a
variety of issues. This commit makes the footer more flexible
with regards to long strings.

pulltitle: Remove non-unified theme and move unified theme to base directory.
pullsbody:
There are relative path issues with keeping the unified theme in a subdirectory. 

When jingo-minify compiles the CSS, it's served out of /media/css, while the relative paths in unified assume they're being served out of a directory adjacent to the image directory. Changing the paths makes local development difficult, because jingo-minify doesn't compile when DEV = True.

The default style handles this by putting its css at the root of the repo, so that using '../global' will reference the same directory whether the CSS is served out of /media/css or /media/global. 

This pull request removes the default theme and adds in unified. DO NOT AUTO-MERGE. When approved, I'll merge this as a new branch rather than merging into master (github doesn't let me create a new branch in a pull request).
pull_repo_desc: Common header/footer templates and CSS for Django-based Mozilla sites.
pull_commit_message: Remove non-unified theme and move unified theme to base directory.

pullsbody:
There are relative path issues with keeping the unified theme in a subdirectory. 

When jingo-minify compiles the CSS, it's served out of /media/css, while the relative paths in unified assume they're being served out of a directory adjacent to the image directory. Changing the paths makes local development difficult, because jingo-minify doesn't compile when DEV = True.

The default style handles this by putting its css at the root of the repo, so that using '../global' will reference the same directory whether the CSS is served out of /media/css or /media/global. 

This pull request removes unified, while another pull request adds it to the repo as another branch that can be specified when creating the global submodules in a django project (with the -b flag).
pull_repo_desc: Common header/footer templates and CSS for Django-based Mozilla sites.
pull_commit_message: Remove unified from repo (moved to branch).

pullsbody:
The unified theme is the current Mozilla.com theme that is intended to be used across most Mozilla properties. Affiliates is going to be using this theme, and I figured now is as good a time as any to add it to django-moz-header so that other django/playdoh based sites can use them easily.

The code for this was taken from Bedrock. The only changes were making image paths in CSS relative and to remove en-US and add mozilla.com to links in the template that needed them.
pull_repo_desc: Common header/footer templates and CSS for Django-based Mozilla sites.
pull_commit_message: Add unified theme code from bedrock with some tweaks.
